     5  
     6  package parlca
     7  
     8  import (
     9  	"crypto/ed25519"
    10  	"crypto/x509"
    11  
    12  	"github.com/haraldrudell/parl/error116"
    13  )
    14  
    15  // x509Certificate extends x509.Certificate with utility methods
    16  type x509Certificate struct {
    17  	*x509.Certificate
    18  }
    19  
    20  func (c *x509Certificate) IsValid() (isValid bool) {
    21  	if !c.HasPublic() {
    22  		return
    23  	}
    24  	cert := c.Certificate
    25  	if cert.SerialNumber == nil ||
    26  		cert.Issuer.CommonName == "" ||
    27  		len(cert.Issuer.Country) == 0 ||
    28  		cert.NotBefore.IsZero() ||
    29  		cert.NotAfter.IsZero() ||
    30  		cert.KeyUsage == 0 {
    31  		return
    32  	}
    33  	isValid = true
    34  	return
    35  }
    36  
    37  func (c *x509Certificate) HasPublic() (hasPublic bool) {
    38  	if len(c.PublicKeyBytes()) == 0 ||
    39  		c.Certificate.PublicKeyAlgorithm == x509.UnknownPublicKeyAlgorithm {
    40  		return
    41  	}
    42  	hasPublic = true
    43  	return
    44  }
    45  
    46  func (c *x509Certificate) PublicKeyBytes() (bytes []byte) {
    47  	if c == nil {
    48  		return
    49  	}
    50  	cert := c.Certificate
    51  	if cert == nil {
    52  		return
    53  	}
    54  	ed25519PublicKey, ok := cert.PublicKey.(ed25519.PublicKey)
    55  	if !ok {
    56  		panic(error116.Errorf("Bad PublicKey type: %T", cert.PublicKey))
    57  	}
    58  	bytes = ed25519PublicKey
    59  	return
    60  }
    61  

Build version go1.17.8.
